idinfo.useconst: THE ENCLOSED REPRODUCTIONS OF HISTORICAL MINE RECORDS ARE PROVIDED SOLELY FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES AND ARE NOT INTENDED FOR USE IN MINERAL EXPLORATION OR CONSTRUCTION OF ANY KIND. THE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION MAKES NO CLAIM, EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, REGARDING THE ACCURACY, COMPLETENESS OR DEGREE OF IMAGE DISTORTION OF SAID INFORMATION.

citeinfo.origin: Pennsylvania Bureau of Mining and Reclamation (BMR)
citeinfo.title: BMR supporting database files for Historical coal seam, mining and permit data for Pennsylvania

pubinfo.publish: Pennsylvania Bureau of Mining and Reclamation

attracc.attraccr: Coverages show the extent of permitting to the best of the draftsman's ability. Denied permits originally drawn on the mylars in red cross hatch were sometimes mistaken for WPA mapped mines. This is particularly true in the north west part of the Bituminous coal field and the entire Anthracite field. There are NO WPA mapped mines in the Anthracite field.

dataqual.complete: Coverage is believed to be complete for all areas with mining or permitting activities, with the following known exceptions: in Cool Spring quad B needs region built and in Reynoldsville quad Ca needs regions built.

horizpa.horizpar: WPA mapping from 1930's may be unreliable and coverages may appear distorted. These coverages are presented to give a reasonable guideline (+/-90) feet of what is on the ground in that area. No attempt was made to correlate coal seams when the quads were digitized. Some coverages for coal seams may appear where the coal seam does not exist. Care should be taken when these anomalies are discovered.

procstep.procdesc: Digitized information drafted onto the 1:24,000 scale mylars using ARC/INFO

overview.eaover: Tables include identification numbers to be used with accompanying database files.
